titleStmt.title: A C\hole\aracter Panegyrick, & Description of ye 08. Legion Club

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I strole the City, oft I
See a building large and lofty
Not a bow-shot from the College
Half the Globe from sens and knowledg,
By the prudent Architect
Plac'd against yẹ Church direct
Making good my Grandames Jest
Near the Church you know the rest
Tell us what this Pile contains
Many a head that holds no brains
These Dæmoniacks let me dubb
With the name of Legion Club
Such assemblies you might sware
Meet when Butchers bait a bear
Such a noise and such haranguing
When a brother theif is hanging
Such a rout and such a rabble
Run to hear Jack Pudding gabble
Such a crowd their Ordure throws
On a far less Villains nose
Coud I from the building Top
Hear the rattling Thunder drop
While the devil upon the roof
(If the Devil is Thunder proof)
Shoud with Poker fiery red
Crack the Stones and melt the Led
Drive them down on every Skull
While the den of thiefs is full
Quite destroy that Harpyes Nest
How might then our Isle be blest
For Divines allow that God
Sometimes makes the Devil his Rod
And the Gosple will inform us
He can punish Sins enormous
Yet shoud S──t endow yẹ Schools
For his Lunaticks and fools
With a rood or two of land
I allow the Pile may stand
You perhaps will ask me why so?
But it is with this proviso
Since yẹ House is like to last
Let a Royal grant be past
That yẹ Club have right to dwell
Each within his proper Cell
With a passage left to creeping
And a hole above for peeping
Let them when they once get in
Sell yẹ Nation for a pin
While they sit a·picking Straws
Let yṃ rave of making Laws
While they never hold their tongue
Let them da\b·over·v\le in their dung
Let them form a grand Committie
How to plague and starve the Citty
Let them stare and storm and frown
When they see a Clergy Gown
Let them e'er they crack a louse
Call for the orders of the house
Let them with their Goslin Quills
Scribble Senseless heads of bills
We may while they strain their throats
Wipe our A────s with their Votes
Let Sṛ Tom that rampant Ass
Stuff his guts with flax and grass
But before the Priest he fleeces
Tear the Bible all to pieces
At the Parsons Tom holloo── boy
Worthy offspring of a Shoe boy
Footman, Traytor, Vile Seducer
Perjurd Rebel brib'd accuser
Lay thy paultry Priviliege aside
Sprung from Papist and a regicide
Fall a·working like a Mole
Raise the dirt about your hole
Come assist me muse obedient
Let us try some new expedient
Shift the Scene for half an hour
Time and place are in your power
Thither gentle muse conduct me
I shall ask and you instruct me
See the Muse unbars the gate
Hark the Monkeys how they prate
All ye Gods who rule the Soul
Styx thro' hell whose waters roll
Let me be allowd to tell
What I heard in yonder Cell
Near the door an entrance gapes
Crowded round with antick Shapes
Poverty and grief and care
Causeless joy and true despare
Discord periwigg'd with snakes
See the dredfull Stride she takes
By this odious crew beset
I began to rage and fret
And resolv'd to break their pates
E'er we enterd at the gates
Had not Clio in the Nick
Whisperd me let down your Stick
What Sḍ I is this the mad house
These, she answer'd are but Shadows
Fantoms bodyless and Vain
Empty Visions of the brain
In the Porch Briaeus Stands
Shews a bribe in all his hands
Briareus the Se──────ry
But we Mortals call him C──y
When the rogues their country fleece
They may hope for pence apiece
Clio who had been so wise
To put on a fools disguise
To bespake some approbation
And be thought a near relation
When she saw two hundred brutes
All involv'd in wild disputes
Roaring till their Lungs were spent
Priviliege of Parliament
Now a new misfortune feels
Dreading to be lai'd by the heels
Never durst a Muse before
Enter that infernal door
Clio Stifled with the smell
In·to Spleen and vapors fell
By yẹ Stygian Streams that flew
From the dire infectious Crew
Not the Stench of Lake Avernus
Cou'd have more offended her nose
Had she flown but ore the top
She might feel her pinions drop
And by exhalations dire
Tho' a Goddess must expire
In a fright she crept away
Bravely I resolv'd to Stay
When I saw yẹ keeper frown
Tipping him with half a Crown
Now Sḍ I we are alone
Name your Heroes one by one
Who is that Hell featurd brawler
Is it Satan, no 'tis Waller
In what figure can a bard dress
Iack the Grandson of Sṛ Hard·dress
Honest keeper drive him further
In his looks are Hell and Murther
See his Scowling Visage drop
Just as when he murther'd thropp
Keeper shew me where to fix
On the Puppy Paṛ of Dicks
By their Lanthron jaws and Leathern
You might swear they both were brethren
Dick Fitz-Baker Dick yẹ Player
Old acquaintance are you there
Dear companions Hugg and kiss
Toast old Glorious in your P──ss
Tie them keeper in a tether
Let yṃ stare and stink together
Both are apt to be unruly
Lash yṃ dayly Lash yṃ duly
Tho 'tis hopeless to reclaim them
Scorpions Rods perhaps may tame yṃ
Keeper yon old dotard smoak,
Sweetly Snoring in his Cloak
Who is he, 'tis hum Drum Wynn
Half encompasst by his Kin
There, observe yẹ tribe of Bingham
For he never fails to bring yṃ
And yt bare Apostate Vesey
With Bishops Scraps made fat and greasy
While he sleeps yẹ whole debate
They submissive round him wait
Yet wou'd gladly see the hunks
In his grave and search his trunks
See they gently twitch his coat
Just to yawn and give his Vote
All·ways firm in his vocation
For the C────t against ye Nation
These are Allens Jack and Bob
First in every wicked job
Son and Brother to a queer
Brain Sick brute they call a Peer
We must give yṃ better quarter
For their ancestor trod Mortar
Who at Howth to boast his fame
In a Chimney cut his name
There sits Clements, Dilks, & Carter
Who for hell wou'd die a Martyr
Such a Triplet cou'd you tell
Where to find on this side hell,
Gallows Carter Dilks & Clements
Sowse them in their own Excrements
om.
om.
Every mischief in their \hearts·over·something·obliterated\
If they fail 'tis want of parts
Bless us Morgan art thou there man
Bless mine eyes art thou the Chairman
Chairman to this damn'd Commitie
Yet I look on thee with pity
Dreadfull sight what Learn'd Morgan
Metamorphosed to a Gorgan,
For thy horrid looks I own
Half convert me to a Stone
Hast thou been so long at School
Now to turn a factious fool
Alma Mater was thy Mother
Every young Divine thy brother
Thou a disobedient Varlet
Treat thy Mother like a Harlot
Thou ungratfull to thy teachers
Who are all grown Revḍ Preachers
Morgan wou'd it not surprise one
Turn thy nourishment to Payson
When you walk among yṛ Books
They reproach you with their looks
Bind them fast unto their shelves
Or they'll come down to write them·selves
Homer, Plutarck, Virgil, Flaccus,
All in arms prepare to back us
Soon repent or put to slaughter
Every Greek & Roman auther
Will you in yẹ factious Prhrase
Send the Clergy all to grase
And to make the project pass
Leave them not a blade of grass
How I want thee humorous Hogart
Thou I hear a pleasant rogue art
Were but you and I acquainted
Every Monster shou'd be painted
You shou'd try yṛ graving Tools
On this Odious groop of fools
Draw the beasts as I describe them
Form their features while I Gibe them.
Draw them like for I assure you
They will want no Carac──────tura
Draw them so that \del·you\we might trace
All their soul in every face
Keeper I must now retire
You have done what I desire
But I feel my Spirits spent
With yẹ noise yẹ sight yẹ sent
Pray be patient you shall find
Half yẹ best are Still behind
You hardly seen a score
I can shew two hundred more
Keeper I've seen enough
Taking then a pinch of Snuff
I concluded looking round them
May their God the Devil confound them
om.
om.
Take them Satan as your due
All except the fifty two
